alert.note: Alert for Creek; Muskogee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CREEK...OKMULGEE... NORTHWESTERN MUSKOGEE AND SOUTH CENTRAL TULSA COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM CDT... At 845 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Bald Hill to 4 miles south of Beggs to 3 miles northeast of Slick. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Morris... Beggs... Mounds... Boynton... Slick... Preston... Bald Hill... Okmulgee State Park... Liberty... Jamesville... Hectorville... Eram... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 195 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
